snippet: More than 900,000 residents signed up for health plans, and premiums have dropped, though the state limited consumers’ choices.
abstract: New York State's Affordable Care Act program is a success, signing up more than 900,000 people, luring16 insurance companies onto its exchange, providing subsidies for most customers and reducing premiums across the board; state's highly centralized system, which limits consumer choice, essentially gives those seeking coverage little incentive to shop elsewhere.
lead_paragraph: More than 900,000 residents signed up for health plans, and premiums have dropped, though the state limited consumers’ choices.

headline.main: In New York, Hard Choices on Health Exchange Spell Success
headline.print_headline: In New York, Hard Choices on Health Exchange Spell Success

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
